citations.narrative:
Three bags of food were being stored on the ground in the sheltered portion of the kennel. Per this requirement, food
must not be stored in the animal area unless it is currently in use and must be stored off the floor. Storage of food
supplies must be addressed to adequately protect the food supplies for the health of the dogs.
Correct by: Nov 20, 2025

The licensee has been trying to deter dogs from soiling their shelter box by adding large buckets and a plastic mesh box.
The size and number of these items in the box has reduced the usable floor space and no longer allows two dogs to sit,
stand and lie down in a normal manner or turn about freely. These items need to be removed from the shelter to allow
both dogs the ability to access the shelter in colder temperatures and move around comfortable for their well being.
Correct by: Nov 20, 2025

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The wire mesh outdoor enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily as there is old feces not falling through the wire mesh.
In addition, there is a large accumulation of feces that is underneath the wire mesh enclosures that is not being removed
as needed to prevent the accumulation. This needs to be addressed and feces removed daily to prevent the dogs from
becoming soiled.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Three bags of food were being stored on the ground in the sheltered portion of the kennel. Per this requirement, food 
must not be stored in the animal area unless it is currently in use and must be stored off the floor. Storage of food 
supplies must be addressed to adequately protect the food supplies for the health of the dogs.  
Correct by: Nov 20, 2025 
3.3(d) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
The licensee has been trying to deter dogs from soiling their shelter box by adding large buckets and a plastic mesh box. 
The size and number of these items in the box has reduced the usable floor space and no longer allows two dogs to sit, 
stand and lie down in a normal manner or turn about freely. These items need to be removed from the shelter to allow 
both dogs the ability to access the shelter in colder temperatures and move around comfortable for their well being.  
Correct by: Nov 20, 2025 
3.11(a)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The wire mesh outdoor enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily as there is old feces not falling through the wire mesh. 
In addition, there is a large accumulation of feces that is underneath the wire mesh enclosures that is not being removed 
as needed to prevent the accumulation. This needs to be addressed and feces removed daily to prevent the dogs from 
becoming soiled. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
